sentence: The main attractions on Saturday were Rep. Liz Cheney, the Wyoming Republican and fierce Trump critic recently removed from GOP House leadership, and Brad Raffensperger, the Republican secretary of state of Georgia who rebuffed Trump's claims of widespread voter fraud.
title: A MAGA gala, a far-right rally, and a plea for Jan. 6 justice: Trio of summits tests GOP's future

sentence: Earlier this month, McCarthy endorsed the GOP primary challenger to Wyoming representative Liz Cheney because of Cheney's role in serving on the committee investigating the January 6 attack on the Capitol.
author: John McCormack
title: Marjorie Taylor Greene's Justification for Appearing at a White-Nationalist Conference Is Preposterous

title: Will GOP leader Kevin McCarthy back Marjorie Taylor Greene's primary challenger, too? National Review asks

sentence: He was then censured by the House and stripped of his committee assignments, but only two Republicans -- Illinois Rep. Adam Kinzinger and Wyoming Rep. Liz Cheney -- voted to censure Gosar for promoting violence.
author: Andrew Kaczynski
title: Rep. Paul Gosar's lengthy ties to White nationalists, pro-Nazi blogger and far-right fringe received little pushback for years

sentence: No matter what happens during that conversation, if it occurs, some of his members saw a potential upside for McCarthy thanks to outside calls for Greene and Gosar to be removed from the conference outright: less right-wing pressure to oust Reps. Liz Cheney (R-Wyo.)
title: Why Republicans may let Greene and Gosar's latest brushfire burn itself out
